intro: Phasellus violaceus, commonly known as the purple phasellus, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Phasellus violaceus prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable addition to gardens and natural habitats.
